{{EngvarB|date=July 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = James Tarkowski | image = James Tarkowski (Oct 2017).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Tarkowski playing for [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in 2017 | fullname = James Alan Tarkowski<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|11|19|df=y}}<ref name=Hugman>{{Hugman|25491|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Manchester]], England | height = {{convert|1.85|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/teams/first-team/defender/james-tarkowski/ |title=James Tarkowski |publisher=Burnley F.C. |accessdate=28 March 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] | youthyears2 = 2009–2011 | youthclubs2 = [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] | years1 = | clubs1 = [[Maine Road F.C.|Maine Road]] | years2 = 2011–2014 | clubs2 = [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] | caps2 = 72 | goals2 = 5 | years3 = 2014–2016 | clubs3 = [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] | caps3 = 70 | goals3 = 4 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | caps4 = 79 | goals4 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2018– | nationalteam1 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 21:21, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 10:56, 9 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''James Alan Tarkowski''' (born 19 November 1992) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for {{English football updater|Burnley}} club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
He began his professional career at [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] of [[EFL League One|League One]], where he made 89 appearances across all competitions. In January 2014, he moved to [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] for an undisclosed fee, winning promotion to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] in his first season. Two years later he signed for Burnley. He made his debut for England in March 2018, starting in a 1–1 draw against Italy.
==Early and personal life== Tarkowski was born in [[Manchester]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/james-tarkowski-237102/ |title=James Tarkowski |website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=28 March 2018}}</ref> and grew up in [[New Moston]].<ref name=grounded>{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Keegan |title=Tarkowski staying grounded despite United links |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/oldham-defender-james-tarkowski-coy-6207277 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=18 October 2013 |accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> He attended New Moston Primary School and [[Failsworth School|Failsworth High School]], which he left in 2009.<ref name=grounded/>
Tarkowski began his career in the youth system at [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]], before being released at the age of 14 at his own request. After his spell at Blackburn, Tarkowski had a stint playing senior football at [[Maine Road F.C.|Maine Road]] in the [[North West Counties Football League|North West Counties League]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-4974926/Burnley-s-James-Tarkowski-no-prima-donna.html|title=Burnley's James Tarkowski is no prima donna - he's into budget holidays and packed lunches: 'I've stayed in some rascal hostels, £2-a-night places!'|newspaper=Daily Mail|date=12 October 2017|accessdate=18 September 2018}}</ref>
He is a Manchester United fan and admired [[David Beckham]] and [[Paul Scholes]] while growing up.<ref name="Crewe 0–2 Oldham" />
==Club career== ===Oldham Athletic=== ====Early years==== Tarkowski joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] on a two-year scholarship in May 2009.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/04/oldham-james-tarkowski-liverpool-luis-suarez-fa-cup|title=Oldham's young James Tarkowski out to muzzle Liverpool's Luis Suárez|author=Wilson, Paul|newspaper=The Guardian|accessdate=17 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Young hopefuls sign up |url=http://www.oldham-chronicle.co.uk/news-features/10/oldham-athletic/24247/young-hopefuls-sign-up |newspaper=Oldham Chronicle |date=12 May 2009 |accessdate=22 January 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140202123132/http://www.oldham-chronicle.co.uk/news-features/10/oldham-athletic/24247/young-hopefuls-sign-up |archivedate=2 February 2014 }}</ref> He made his reserve-team debut in October 2009. A [[centre back]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.oldhamathletic.co.uk/team/player-profile/index.aspx?playerid=460961 |title=Oldham Athletic AFC Player Profiles |publisher=Oldham Athletic A.F.C. |date=6 July 2013 |accessdate=21 April 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140202225154/http://www.oldhamathletic.co.uk/team/player-profile/index.aspx?playerid=460961 |archivedate=2 February 2014 }}</ref> Tarkowski was called up to the first team for the first time for a league match versus [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] on 15 January 2011.<ref>{{cite web |title=Scholars win first team calls |url=http://www.oldhamathletic.co.uk/page/NewsUpdate/0,,10337~2266393,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110116104610/http://www.oldhamathletic.co.uk/page/NewsUpdate/0%2C%2C10337~2266393%2C00.html |archivedate=16 January 2011 |publisher=Oldham Athletic A.F.C. |date=14 January 2011 |accessdate=22 January 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> His senior debut came on 22 January, coming on as an 80th-minute substitute for the injured [[Neal Trotman]] in a 2–1 home win over [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Oldham 2–1 Brentford |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/9362041.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 January 2011 |accessdate=22 January 2011 }}</ref> Tarkowski made his first Latics start in a 1–0 defeat to [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]] on 12 March and played the full 90 minutes.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/155226/james-tarkowski?season=2010|title=James Tarkowski |website=ESPN FC |accessdate=17 August 2015}}</ref> He was awarded a two-year professional contract by the club in May 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.oldhamathletic-mad.co.uk/news/tmnw/tarkowski_signs__pro_deal_679577/index.shtml |title=Tarkowski signs pro deal |website=Latics Mad |publisher=Digital Sports Group |date=28 May 2011 |accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> He made 9 appearances during the second half of the [[2010–11 Oldham Athletic A.F.C. season|2010–11 season]].<ref name=sb1011/>
Tarkowski had to wait until 10 December 2011 to make his first appearance of the [[2011–12 Oldham Athletic A.F.C. season|2011–12 season]],<ref name=espn>{{cite web|url = http://www.espnfc.com/player/155226/james-tarkowski?season=2011|title = James Tarkowski|publisher=ESPN FC |accessdate = 17 August 2015}}</ref> when he came on as a 61st-minute substitute for [[Jean-Yves Mvoto]] in a 2–0 home defeat to [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16015587 |title=Oldham 0–2 Sheffield Wed |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 December 2011 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> A half time substitute appearance in Oldham's 2–1 [[Football League Trophy]] Northern Area final first leg defeat to [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] on 30 January 2012 kicked off a run which saw Tarkowski included in almost all of Oldham's first-team squads until the end of the season.<ref name=espn /> Tarkowski crowned his run of appearances by scoring his first senior goal for the club on the final day of the season in a 2–1 win over [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]].<ref name="firstoldhamgoal">{{cite news |title=Oldham 2–1 Carlisle|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17878476|accessdate=5 May 2012|publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 May 2012}}</ref> He made 18 appearances during the 2011–12 season and scored one goal.<ref name=sb1112/>
====Breakthrough==== [[File:James Tarkowski 21-07-2012 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Tarkowski playing for [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] in 2012]]
Tarkowski began the [[2012–13 Oldham Athletic A.F.C. season|2012–13 season]] as a first-choice centre back alongside Jean-Yves Mvoto and started Oldham's first six games of the season.<ref name=sb1213/> He scored his first goal of the season in a 2–0 league win over [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] on 2 October 2012.<ref name="Crewe 0–2 Oldham">{{cite news |last=Scott |first=Ged |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19709768 |title=Crewe Alexandra 0–2 Oldham Athletic |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 October 2012 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> Tarkowski played a part in Oldham's run to the fifth round of the [[FA Cup]], playing in the first round win over [[Conference Premier]] team [[Kidderminster Harriers F.C.|Kidderminster Harriers]] and starting in the home draw and away replay defeat to [[Premier League]] team [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in the fifth round.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/155226/james-tarkowski?season=2012|title=James Tarkowski|publisher=ESPN FC|accessdate=17 August 2015}}</ref> He scored his second goal of the season in a 2–1 league win over [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] on 19 February 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21448791 |title=Stevenage 1–2 Oldham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 February 2013 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> Tarkowski made 26 appearances and scored two goals during the 2012–13 season.<ref name=sb1213/> He signed a new two-year contract in the summer of 2013.<ref>{{cite news | title = Tarkowski Signs New Contract | url = http://www.oldhamathletic.co.uk/news/article/20130613-tarkowski-863934.aspx | publisher = Oldham Athletic A.F.C. | date = 13 June 2013 | accessdate = 13 June 2013}}</ref>
Tarkowski began the [[2013–14 Oldham Athletic A.F.C. season|2013–14 season]] with a bang, scoring Oldham's first goal in a 4–3 away league win over Stevenage on the opening day.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23474975 |title=Stevenage 3–4 Oldham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 August 2013 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> He was picked by the Latics supporters as Oldham's Player of the Month for August 2013.<ref name=oldham2292013>{{cite web|url=http://www.oldhamathletic.co.uk/news/article/20130922-potm-1069654.aspx |title=Tarkowski wins award |publisher=Oldham Athletic A.F.C. |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> Now lining up at centre back alongside [[Jonathan Grounds]],<ref name=grounded/> Tarkowski scored his second goal in a 2–1 defeat to [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] on 9 September 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23925593 |title=Preston 2–1 Oldham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 September 2013 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> Tarkowski was an ever-present in Oldham's runs to the Northern Area semi-final of the Football League Trophy and the third round of the FA Cup.<ref name=sb1314/> He started the FA Cup third round tie against Premier League team [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[Anfield]] and scored an 82nd minute [[own goal]], which consigned the Latics to a 2–0 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |last=Sanghera |first=Mandeep |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25539775 |title=Liverpool 2–0 Oldham Athletic |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> Tarkowski's form saw him offered a new contract extending until the end of the 2016–17 season on 22 January 2014,<ref>{{cite news | title = Oldham: James Tarkowski offered new Latics deal | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25846815 | publisher = BBC Sport | accessdate = 22 January 2014}}</ref> but he departed [[Boundary Park]] 9 days later.<ref name=Brentford31114>{{cite web|url=http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/news/article/james-tarkowski-31.01.14-1330159.aspx |title=Brentford Sign James Tarkowski |publisher=Brentford F.C. |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> During his time with the Latics, Tarkowski made 89 appearances and scored six goals.<ref name=soccerbase/>
===Brentford=== Tarkowski signed for League One club Brentford on a three-and-a-half-year contract for an undisclosed fee on 31 January 2014.<ref name=Brentford31114/> After a period on the bench, he made his Brentford debut with a start in a 0–0 draw away to Carlisle United on 1 March.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26301913 |title=Carlisle United 0–0 Brentford |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 March 2014 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on his third appearance, heading in to send the Bees on their way to a 2–0 victory over [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] on 11 March.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26428674 |title=Brentford 2–0 Tranmere Rovers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 March 2014 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> Four days later, Tarkowski was [[Red card (football)|sent off]] for the second time in his career during a 1–0 win over Leyton Orient.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26492931 |title=Leyton Orient 0–1 Brentford |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 March 2014 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> Following Brentford's promotion to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] on 18 April, Tarkowski scored his second goal for the club in a 2–2 draw at [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] on 21 April.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27016685 |title=Milton Keynes Dons 2–2 Brentford |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2013 |accessdate=21 April 2014}}</ref> He finished the [[2013–14 Brentford F.C. season|2013–14 season]] with 13 appearances and two goals.<ref name=sb1314/>
Tarkowski began his first season at Championship level as an ever-present in the Bees' league matches.<ref name=sb1415/> He suffered a dip in form in September and early October, stepping up to take his first [[Penalty (association football)|penalty]] for the club in a league match versus [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] on 27 September and hammering the ball over the bar.<ref name=":7">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29289510|title=Brentford 2–0 Leeds United|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 May 2015}}</ref> He was spared his blushes, with [[Jota (footballer)|Jota]] and [[Alan McCormack]] on target in the eventual 2–0 win.<ref name=":7" /> Tarkowski gave away a penalty in a 2–1 defeat to [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 30 September and received his fourth [[Yellow card (association football)|yellow card]] of the season (his third in four matches).<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29320618|title=Watford 2–1 Brentford|author=Osborne, Chris|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 May 2015}}</ref> Another yellow card in a 0–0 draw with [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on 18 October saw him incur a suspension and he failed to appear again until 28 December,<ref name=sb1415/> scoring what proved to be [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]' winner with an own goal in a 2–1 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30566334|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2–1 Brentford|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 May 2015}}</ref> Despite the blunder, Tarkowski held onto his starting place and scored his first goal of the season against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 25 April 2015, making sure of the points with the second in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/155226/james-tarkowski?season=2014|title=James Tarkowski|publisher=ESPN FC |accessdate=3 May 2015}}</ref> Tarkowski had the opportunity to convert a late penalty to make it two goals in two games in the following match against Wigan Athletic, but his miss made little difference with the Bees already 3–0 ahead.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32460049|title=Brentford 3–0 Wigan Athletic|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=3 May 2015}}</ref> He appeared in both legs of Brentford's 5–1 [[2015 Football League play-offs#Championship|playoff semi-final]] aggregate defeat to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] and finished the [[2014–15 Brentford F.C. season|2014–15]] season with 38 appearances and one goal.<ref name=sb1415/>
Tarkowski helped salvage a 2–2 draw with [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on the opening day of the [[2015–16 Brentford F.C. season|2015–16]] season, [[Assist (football)|feeding]] [[Andre Gray]] to score in [[injury time]],<ref>{{cite news|title = Brentford 2–2 Ipswich Town|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744133|publisher = BBC Sport |accessdate = 9 August 2015}}</ref> before bundling home a 96th-minute equaliser to earn a place in the [[English Football League|Football League]] Team of the Week.<ref>{{cite web|title = Sky Bet Football League Team of the Week|url = http://www.football-league.co.uk/news/article/2015/sky-bet-football-league-team-of-the-week-2607652.aspx|publisher = The Football League|accessdate = 10 August 2015|first = Alex|last = Butcher}}</ref> He suffered a [[Displacement (orthopedic surgery)|displaced fracture]] of the nose in the following match versus [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]],<ref>{{cite web|title = Brentford FC Injury update|url = http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/news/article/brentford-fc-injury-update-18.08.15-2629059.aspx|publisher=Brentford F.C. |accessdate = 27 September 2015|first = Brentford|last = FC}}</ref> but kept his place alongside Harlee Dean until suffering a calf injury in a 1–1 draw with Leeds United on 12 September.<ref>{{cite web|title = September injury update|url = http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/news/article/september-injury-update-23.09.15-2705230.aspx|publisher=Brentford F.C. |accessdate = 27 September 2015|first = Brentford|last = FC}}</ref> He missed two matches before being [[Red card (association football)|sent off]] on his return in a 2–1 defeat to Sheffield Wednesday.<ref>{{cite news |title = Brentford 1–2 Sheffield Wednesday|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34300233|publisher = BBC Sport |accessdate = 27 September 2015}}</ref> Amidst a number of transfer bids,<ref>{{Cite news|title = Brentford's James Tarkowski refuses to play in match against Burnley|url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jan/15/brentford-james-tarkowski-burnley-championship|newspaper = The Guardian|date = 15 January 2016|accessdate = 25 January 2016|issn = 0261-3077 |agency=Press Association}}</ref> Tarkowski was internally disciplined for refusing to play in Brentford's match versus [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on 15 January 2016,<ref>{{cite web|title = Club statement: James Tarkowski|url = http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/news/article/club-statement-james-tarkowski-15.01.16-2903724.aspx|publisher=Brentford F.C. |accessdate = 15 January 2016}}</ref> for which he later apologised.<ref>{{cite web|title = James Tarkowski issues personal statement|url = http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/news/article/james-tarkowki-issues-personal-statement-25.01.16-2920320.aspx#l2Ohe2lhYXp4tpuF.99|publisher=Brentford F.C. |accessdate = 25 January 2016}}</ref> He failed to appear for the Bees again and departed [[Griffin Park]] two weeks later, having made 74 appearances and scored four goals in two years with the club.<ref name="soccerbase">{{cite web|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=58187 |title=5 James Tarkowski |website=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=11 August 2018}}</ref>
===Burnley=== [[File:James Tarkowski TomHeaton.jpg|thumb|upright|Tarkowski (centre) playing for [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in 2017]]
On 1 February 2016, Tarkowski signed a three-and-a-half-year contract with Championship club Burnley for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Clarets Sign James Tarkowski |url=http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/news/article/clarets-sign-james-tarkowski-2932970.aspx |publisher=Burnley FC |date=1 February 2016 |accessdate=1 February 2016}}</ref> Tarkowski made his club debut on 20 February against [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]], entering as a substitute in the first half for [[Michael Keane (footballer, born 1993)|Michael Keane]], who was forced off with a head injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/14293941.Defender_James_Tarkowski_believes_there_s_more_to_come_from_Burnley_side/ |title=Defender James Tarkowski believes there's more to come from Burnley side |newspaper=Lancashire Telegraph |first=Suzanne |last=Geldard |date=22 February 2016}}</ref> Tarkowski deputised for Keane for the next two games, with Burnley victorious against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] and [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.newsshopper.co.uk/news/14339170.Clarets_defender_Keane_praises_Tarkowski__but_is_happy_to_be_back_in_the_side/ |title=Clarets defender Keane praises Tarkowski, but is happy to be back in the side |newspaper=News Shopper |first=Suzanne |last=Geldard |date=12 March 2016}}</ref> However, Keane was preferred by manager [[Sean Dyche]] at right [[Defender (association football)|centre-back]] upon his return to fitness as Tarkowski was limited to one substitution appearance the rest of the season. In third position in the table at the time of Tarkowski's signing, Burnley went unbeaten the rest of the season as they won their third ever second-tier title and direct promotion to the [[2016–17 Premier League|Premier League]] on their first attempt.
Tarkowski was handed the [[Captain (association football)|captain's armband]] for Burnley's 1–0 extra-time defeat to fourth-tier [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] in the [[2016–17 EFL Cup#Second round|EFL Cup]] on 24 August, after Dyche had made 10 changes to the team that upset Liverpool four days prior.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37103144 |title=Accrington Stanley 1–0 Burnley (AET) |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2016}}</ref> Tarkowski made his Premier League debut on 27 August at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], coming on as a substitute and receiving a booking for a foul in the run-up to Chelsea's final goal in the 3–0 defeat.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uptheclarets.com/no-answer-to-chelsea |title=No answer to Chelsea |website=UpTheClarets |first=Tony |last=Scholes |date=28 August 2016}}</ref> Unable to crack the preferred centre-back partnership of Keane and [[Ben Mee]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/15020080._It___s_not_been_easy____Burnley_defender_James_Tarkowski_admits_life_on_bench_can_be_tough/ |title='It's not been easy' – Burnley defender James Tarkowski admits life on bench can be tough |newspaper=Lancashire Telegraph |first=Tyrone |last=Marshall |date=12 January 2017}}</ref> Tarkowski received scant playing time, despite being an ever-present on the bench.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/news/2017/april/tarkowski-no-loss-of-momentum/ |title=Tarkowski: No Loss Of Momentum |publisher=Burnley F.C. |date=26 April 2017}}</ref> He was a halftime substitution on 23 April 2017 against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for Mee, who left with a shin injury,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/burnley/379/blog/post/3110996/burnley-fall-to-deserved-defeat-vs-man-united-as-joey-barton-struggles |title=Burnley fall to deserved defeat vs Man United as Joey Barton struggles |publisher=ESPN FC |first=Jamie |last=Smith |date=23 April 2017}}</ref> opening the door for his first Premier League start on 29 April against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]. Tarkowski endured being hit by an object thrown by a Palace fan during celebrations of [[Ashley Barnes]]' opening goal, as well as keeping [[Christian Benteke]] in his back pocket en route to a clean sheet. Manager Dyche lauded his performance as "outstanding".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/15259045.Sean_Dyche_hails__outstanding__James_Tarkowski_as_battle_for_places_in_Burnley_side_hots_up/ |title=Sean Dyche hails 'outstanding' James Tarkowski as battle for places in Burnley side hots up |newspaper=Lancashire Telegraph |first=Tyrone |last=Marshall |date=3 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/burnley/379/blog/post/3118567/james-tarkowski-capable-of-filling-the-void-left-by-michael-keane-at-burnley |title=James Tarkowski capable of filling the void left by Michael Keane at Burnley |publisher=ESPN FC |first=Jamie |last=Smith |date=4 May 2017}}</ref> Tarkowski would retain his place in the team for Burnley's final four fixtures, during which Burnley ensured their participation in the [[2017–18 Premier League|next edition]].
During the summer transfer window, teammate Michael Keane departed for Everton, allowing Tarkowski to line up with Mee in the center of Burnley's defense on a full-time basis.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/burnley-not-planning-replace-michael-10992919 |title=Burnley not planning to replace Michael Keane – because they have a ready-made successor in the building |newspaper=Daily Mirror |first=David |last=Anderson |date=15 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11671/10935840/michael-keane-joins-everton-from-burnley |title=Michael Keane joins Everton from Burnley |publisher=Sky Sports |first=Dev |last=Trahan |date=4 July 2017}}</ref> Assigned the shirt number 26 initially, Tarkowski assumed the number 5 shirt vacated by Keane ahead of the season. Tarkowski's performance against Crystal Palace on 10 September was deemed Man of the Match worthy by [[Sky Sports]], as Tarkowski held Benteke and Palace without a goal.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/15529718.Sean_Dyche_backs_defensive_work_of_James_Tarkowski_as_he_cements_Burnley_place/ |title=Sean Dyche backs defensive work of James Tarkowski as he cements Burnley place |newspaper=Lancashire Telegraph |first=Tyrone |last=Marshall |date=13 September 2017}}</ref> His 17 clearances in the match were the most by anyone in the Premier League that season, besting a mark previously held by himself in Burnley's surprise opening day victory over Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11708/11054419/is-defending-a-dying-art-burnleys-james-tarkowski-bucks-the-trend |title=Is defending a dying art? Burnley's James Tarkowski bucks the trend |publisher=Sky Sports |first=Adam |last=Bates |date=27 September 2017}}</ref>
==International career== Tarkowski was eligible to play for Poland through his grandfather but preferred to play for England, stating "I've always seen myself as an English person so to play for Poland would be difficult,"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12016/11298525/england-new-boy-james-tarkowski-admits-playing-for-poland-would-have-been-difficult|title=England new-boy James Tarkowski admits playing for Poland would have been 'difficult'|first=|last=|date=20 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/football-notebook-burnley-star-holding-out-for-england-lgf9fkbjb |title=Football Notebook: Burnley star holding out for England |first=Matt |last=Hughes |newspaper=The Times |location=London |date=16 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/former-bee-good-enough-play-13738531|title=Former Bee good enough to play for England – and we get more money if he does – says Brentford owner|first=Tim|last=Street|date=9 October 2017}}</ref> On 15 March 2018, he was named in the [[England national football team|England]] squad for pre-[[2018 FIFA World Cup]] friendlies against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] and [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in March.<ref>{{cite news |title=England call-ups for uncapped quartet as Jack Wilshere earns recall |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43344416 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 March 2018 |accessdate=15 March 2018}}</ref> He made his debut on 27 March when starting in the 1–1 draw with Italy at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 1–1 Italy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43466395 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 March 2018 |accessdate=27 March 2018}}</ref>
On 16 May 2018, he was one of 5 players named on standby for [[Gareth Southgate]]'s 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> but Tarkowski was reported to have withdrawn from the standby list later for hernia operation.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44275387 |title=Burnley defender James Tarkowski to leave England set-up for hernia operation |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 May 2018 |accessdate=27 May 2018}}</ref>
